title: BBC East Yorkshire & Humber Live Friday 11 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: icelandic fishermen 's strike threatens grimsby supplies .
war memorial given listed status to mark armistice day .
cash boost to speed up new homes in grimsby and cleethorpes .
pm urges india to make progress on ex-soldiers firearms case .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's all from your live news feed for today , thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates .
but in the meantime here are five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: wife of man jailed in india pins hopes on pm 's lobbying
text: the wife of an east yorkshire man jailed in india after working on an anti-piracy patrol has said she hopes lobbying by prime minister theresa may will help with his release .
paul towers from pocklington is one of six britons jailed for firearms offences .
mrs may raised the issue during a recent visit to india .
ann towers said she was hoping an appeal against the men 's five-year sentences would start soon .

documents.title: charity box thieves sought by police
text: police want to speak to these two men ( in connection with the robbery of two charity collection boxes from the hop pole pub in willerby .
a royal british legion poppy appeal box and a local hos charity collection box were taken from the pub on kingston road at about 10:00 on 2 november .
police are asking anyone with any information to call them on the 101 number .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: brothers race in memory of hull harriers athletes killed in wwi
text: three brothers , mark , paul and stephen wright , have travelled up from kent to run a race with the city of hull athletic club .
it 's in memory of their great-uncle who was a member of the hull harriers and who died in one of the last battles of the somme .
nineteen men took part in the hull harriers ' 1914 club championship .
seven of them did n't come back from the war :
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: barton school to lose its sixth form
text: the sixth form at baysgarth school ( in barton is to close because its not financially viable .
the school says it has just 46 students in its sixth form and the government benchmark is 200 .
students who are currently in year 11 will be able to finish their studies at the school , but the head teacher richard briggs says they will not take on any more sixth formers .
barton is quite unique in the sense that it is central to other sixth form centres and colleges such as scunthorpe , hull and grimsby , so there is plenty of provision close by .
students do not rely on barton as their only means of accessing sixth form education . ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: bid to save the last manned lightship on the humber
text: i 've been to meet a retired boat builder who 's hoping britain 's last manned lightship will find a new lease of life as a houseboat .
the middle whitton was decommissioned in 1986 and is now lying semi-derelict on the river hull at beverley .
roger russell says he 's contacted the ship 's owner and hopes a way can be found to restore the 109-year-old vessel .
you can hear the full story on breakfast on monday morning with lizzie and carl .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: rugby : abdull to join hull kr
text: hull kingston rovers have confirmed that hull fc half-back jordan abdull will join them on a year-long loan .
that 's despite recently signing a long-term deal with the black and whites .
he joins the likes of jamie ellis and andrew heffernan in committing to the robins for next season .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: appeal to trace cyclist
text: police are looking for a cyclist after a bus passenger died when the driver took `` evasive action '' to avoid a collision on a hull road .
a 66-year-old man from scunthorpe suffered serious injuries in the incident on anlaby road on 31 august .
he was taken to hospital with head , chest and spinal injuries where he died on 24 september .
after an appeal for witnesses last month police say they want to talk to a cyclist seen in the area at the time .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: non-emergency ambulance services in hull to be run by private company
text: thames ambulance service is to take over the running of some ambulances services in hull from april next year .
the nhs hull clinical commissioning group has confirmed they 've been given the contract to run non-emergency patient transport services in hull .
about 4,000 non-emergency journeys are made in the city each month , mainly for cancer and kidney dialysis patients .
the company already operates in northern lincolnshire .
ray gray from unison says he 's not happy about the decision :
we were bitterly disappointed that the contract was lost .
we do n't understand why its been lost because it was an excellent service provided by really good staff and the only logical answer is they 've gone for the cheapest bidder . ''
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: man denies riding instructor murder
text: a man has pleaded not guilty to the murder of a riding instructor found dead at a farm in east yorkshire .
sixty-year-old fiona southwell died at grange farm near seaton in july .
daniel edwards , 21 , from hornsea appeared at hull crown court this morning .
he spoke only to confirm his name and to enter a plea of not guilty to the charge of murder .
he has been remanded in custody until a trial scheduled to take place in january .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: what 's the weather got in store this weekend ?
text: here 's my forecast
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: sport : you 're on a promise grimsby fans
text: grimsby town are on course for one of their biggest home attendances of the season when they face barnet tomorrow .
a crowd of more than 5,000 is expected at blundell park for marcus bignot 's first league game in charge .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber
text: latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: cyclist sought in bus passenger death investigation
text: police investigating the death of a bus passenger in hull say they want to trace this cyclist :
the passenger - a 66-year-old man from scunthorpe - was injured when the humber fast cat .
braked suddenly on anlaby road at about 14:00 on 31 august .
he died in hospital on the 24 september .
police are asking anyone with any information to contact them on the 101 number .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: man bailed following explosives scare
text: a man has been released on bail following a raid by ministry of defence police in hull yesterday .
a bomb disposal team was called to the industrial park on hawthorne avenue after officers discovered what they believed were explosives .
they 've since confirmed that what they found were pyrotechnics .
the mod says a 24-year-old local man was arrested and has been released on bail until january .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: investigation launched into grimsby 's 'crazy paving '
text: you might remember us telling you about the so-called `` crazy paving '' in grimsby town centre .
it had to be ripped up at a cost of thousands because it was cracking under the weight of the buses that were driving over it .
well now north east lincolnshire council is investigating the reasons behind why it happened in the first place .
the company which was responsible for laying the paving has had to foot the repair bill .
last week it was all taken up and tarmac was laid in its place .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: cleethorpes poppy cascade honours war dead
text: ten thousand poppies cascade from the doorway of the knoll in cleethorpes to commemorate armistice day :
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: disruption on a63 eastbound
text: there is queuing traffic on the a63 clive sullivan way eastbound between the priory way junction and st andrews quay because of a broken-down vehicle and tyre on the road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: war memorial listed for armistice day
text: a war memorial in withernsea has been given listed status to mark armistice day .
withernsea 's old war memorial in the italian gardens on queen street is among 50 monuments in england given protection by historic england .
the heritage body says it wants 2,500 memorials listed by the government in time for the centenary of the end of world war one in 2018 .
the limestone cross and plinth was unveiled on 16 april 1921 and bears the names of 63 men killed in the great war .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pm calls for progress on india firearms case
text: the prime minister , theresa may , has raised the importance of seeing progress on the case of two east yorkshire men who are jailed in india .

paul towers , from pocklington , and ray tindall , originally from hull but who now lives in chester , are among six british men spending time in an indian jail after they were convicted of firearms charges earlier this year .
the men continue to protest their innocence and are currently awaiting the outcome of an appeal which has been lodged against their sentences .
we recognise what a difficult time this is for those involved and we have taken significant action on this case .
the prime minister raised the importance of seeing progress on the case with pm modi during her visit to india .
alok sharma , the foreign office minister for asia pressed for progress during his first official visit in july and again last month . ''

documents.title: armistice day 2016 : two minutes ' silence marks day of national remembrance
text: a two-minute silence will be observed across the uk at 11:00 to remember the nation 's war dead for armistice day .
prince harry will lay a wreath at the national memorial arboretum in staffordshire for the commemorations .
commemorations will also take place across our region .
pupils at st mary 's primary school in beverley are also creating a wall of remembrance made from poppies .
each individual poppy will represent a beverley soldier who lost his life in war .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: new homes for grimsby and cleethorpes
text: more than 1,000 new houses could be built on brownfield sites in north east lincolnshire .
the government has named the area as one of its new `` housing zones '' , where councils work in partnership with private developers to build new homes .
north east lincolnshire council say that they still need to identify potential sites .
housing minister gavin barwell says the aim is to speed up building work :
what the housing zone does is enable people to get access to our £ 3bn home building fund .
they are one of the areas that get priority to the fund , so there is the offer of more funding but also support from the government . ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: headlines across east yorkshire and the humber
text: headlines across east yorkshire and the humber
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: look at the shadows ! hull 's lost trawlermen memorial sculpture
text: iron men who sailed in steel ships.figures for new hull lost trawlermen memorial by peter naylor being cut ystrdy.look at shadows they cast
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: legal action remove hull 'tent city ' homeless protesters
text: we 've been hearing on breakfast that it 's possible hull 's so called tent city may move to another area , away from queen 's gardens .
yesterday the council started legal proceedings to remove the protestors from the site .
campaigners say they want the city 's homeless to be provided with permanent accommodation .
hull city council says it 's offered emergency accommodation to those sleeping in tent city .
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sport : the latest rugby news
text: breaking : # hullkr & # hullfc confirm black & white 's half-back jordan abdull has joined the robins on a season-long loan .
author: Joshua Cook
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : 'catastrophic ' iceland fish strike
text: we 've had confirmation this morning that icelandic fishermen will go on strike .
fish processors in grimsby say the supply of fish from iceland could be disrupted or even stopped .
we 've been speaking to martin boyers , chief executive for the port of grimsby , who says they do n't know how long the strike will last for :
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : a cold start to the day
text: here 's a look at the weather for today with me , alina jenkins :
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning , gill here with all the latest updates on your news , sport , travel and weather on friday 11 november 2016 .
it 's remembrance day when millions of people wear poppies as a symbol to remember all of the people who have given their lives for their country in war .
some of our weather watchers have been marking the day already .
here 's a couple of their
if you want to get in touch with your or stories you can email us or contact me via facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside
